body:
While what you're saying makes a lot of sense, and I agree with most of it, I just think that if you have a plain simple helper struct, with a trivial constructor and 2 one-liner methods, then it's an overkill to keep an extra file, especially that this code **should** be inlined.

Fortunately we're not at 30min build times, so we can afford having a more relaxed development model (although I agree that having to recompile 90 files when `ir.h` changes is a bit of a pain).

Fortunately we're not at 30min build times, so we can afford having a more relaxed development model (although I agree that having to recompile 90 files when ir.h changes is a bit of a pain).
body_text:
While what you're saying makes a lot of sense, and I agree with most of it, I just think that if you have a plain simple helper struct, with a trivial constructor and 2 one-liner methods, then it's an overkill to keep an extra file, especially that this code should be inlined.
Fortunately we're not at 30min build times, so we can afford having a more relaxed development model (although I agree that having to recompile 90 files when ir.h changes is a bit of a pain).
